title.narrative: Provision of emergency life-saving primary health care service and Nutrition interventions to internally displaced persons and drought affected host communities in Badhaade district Lower Juba region

description.narrative: The project is to provide emergency life-saving emergency primary health and Nutrition services to 19,100 people (Nutrition: 2500 Boys, 2900 Girls and 2000 PLW/ Health: 3000 Boys, 4200 Girls, 3000 Women, 1500 men) drought affected direct beneficiaries in Badhaade district, through the provision of three (3) mobile clinics and one MCH as well as 6 OTP mobile/outreach and two static Nutrition OTP services. Emphasis will be on maternal, neonatal and child health including emergency immunization to the host communities and Internally Displaced People (IDPs) as well as treatment of severe acute malnutrition. This action will focus on provision of both preventive and curative health and nutrition services at primary level integrated with Nutrition activities that are undertaken by SA. Building the capacity of health workers through training on integrated management of childhood illness (IMCI), community case management (CCM) as well as cholera and measles management training and basic obstetric care training that will be conducted to equip health workers with the required skills to deliver quality health care services to the affected population as well as capacity building of nutrition staff on IMAM/IYCF services, infants young child feeding best practices (IYCF), Nutrition, health and hygiene promotion (NHHP) as well as conduct caregivers infant and young child feeding practices (IYCF) promotion session for better information dissemination to the caregivers in the project area. Referral of malnourished children with complicated cases will be done to the Outpatient Therapeutic Programme (OTP) centers integrated with primary health care services managed by SA and other actors in the Badhaade lower Juba region. The proposed response took into consideration the impact of the drought/AWD/cholera affected women, and children in terms of access to Health and Nutrition services. The OTP sites will be provide with clean drinking water and appetite test that will be able to ensure proper basic nutrition services delivery in the target sites. To ensure proper services delivery at the static MCH and OTP in Kolbio,Hosingo and Waraq Southern aid will procure chairs and tables for the beneficiaries at shades and waiting bays sites. SA with the technical guidance of Federal ministry of health, UNICEF and WHO as well as the health and nutrition Cluster will also integrate surveillance and emergency preparedness in the program so that enough steps are taken in ensuring early response to both health and nutrition cases. Finally, SA will coordinate with Health and Nutrition clusters to coordinate response activities for maximum impact to beneficiaries in the targeted project.SA shall also coordinates with other local actors in the target district to enable avoid any duplication of services as well work in a coordinated manner to enable increase access to life-saving emergency response in the areas
